summary: This is a 1996 NYPD complaint report documenting a harassment incident where Jeffrey Epstein allegedly threatened to burn the victim's paintings and send her Polaroids of the burnt paintings. The report lists Epstein as the wanted suspect and includes victim and witness information, though their names are partially redacted. The case was closed.

persons.name: Jeffery Epstein
persons.context: Listed as the wanted person for aggravated harassment; allegedly called the victim and threatened to burn her paintings.

persons.name: Po Chandler, Cioloe
persons.context: NYPD officer who reported or investigated the complaint.

persons.name: Sot Zulch
persons.context: NYPD supervisor who approved the complaint report.

persons.name: Faa Marsala, Margar
persons.context: NYPD personnel who entered the complaint report into the system.

connections.description: Epstein is the alleged perpetrator who threatened the victim.
The witness provided the statement about Epstein's threats to the victim.

events.title: Harassment Threat Incident
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein allegedly called the victim and stated he was going to burn her paintings and send her Polaroids of the burnt paintings.

events.title: Complaint Filed
events.description: The harassment complaint was filed as a walk-in report.

locations: 9 East 71 Street, NYC, New York (Epstein's residence)
Precinct 006, Sector H, Beat 11, Post 32 (NYPD jurisdiction)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was listed as a wanted suspect in a 1996 NYPD aggravated harassment case.
The allegation involved Epstein threatening to burn the victim's paintings and send Polaroids of the burnt paintings.
Epstein reportedly had keys to the victim's apartment at the time.
The case status is marked as closed, with no arrest indicated.
The victim and witness names are partially redacted in the document.
